content: the snow day leg warmers are a 2x2 half twisted rib leg warmer with a tubular bind off at the end to ensure a snug fit on the leg they are constructed bottom-up they use a worsted or aran weight yarn and are super warm and squishy cozy cute coquette ^___^ this project was heavily inspired by dawn wang s pinterest-worthy ribbed leg warmers 1 as theirs is also a 2x2 rib check out their pattern especially if you want to use a lighter weight yarn **gauge** 18 stitches = 10 cm using 4 5mm us 7 needles the gauge is flexible for this pattern as it is just a tube you can always cast on work about 2-3 inches then carefully try on to see if the width is satisfying to you there is also flexibility in how tight the top becomes **suggested materials** * yarn any worsted or aran weight yarn or any yarn that obtains gauge i used cascade 220 superwash aran in the color white sands i used 160g/220m which was a little under 2 skeins you can make them shorter/less slouchy if you d like to use less yarn or you can make them as tall as you d like * needles size 4 5 mm/us 7 circular needles 30-40 cm/12-16 in length or magic loop i did not need to use magic loop until after the decrease round when i got into the double knitting you could probably use double pointed needles instead if that is your preference **finished size** the size can be tailored to what you prefer in terms of length and even width by adjusting the number of cast on stitches the final blocked size of mine was approximately -31 cm/12 in long -13 cm/5 in wide unstretched tutorial for transposing/tubular bind off here 2 let me know if you have any questions please add photos if you end up using this pattern <3 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/pinterest-worthy-ribbed-leg-warmers 2 https //www youtube com/watch v=mvqp8r02rqa&t=0s
